pages.title: Reagent Vessels
pages.text: <item>Reagent Vessels/$ are the core machines for automating <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reactions/$. There are two versions: The <item>Storage Vessel/$, for storing <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reagents/$, and the <item>Reaction Vessel/$, for performing <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reactions/$.$(br2)Both will retain their contents when broken, have glass and crystal versions,

and can connect to <item>$(l:crossroads:alchemy/conduit)reagent conduits/$ on any side. Hoppers can insert or extract the solid form of <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reagents/$ as items, which can also be added/removed by right clicking (with the item to add, empty hand to remove). Buckets of the liquid form can also be used.$(br2)

The <item>Storage Vessel/$ can store 1000 units of <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reagents/$. They <em>will not/$ allow <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reactions/$ to occur inside them. They are used for bulk storage of <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reagents/$.$(br2)

The <item>Reaction Vessel/$ can store 200 units of <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reagents/$. They <em>will/$ allow <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reactions/$ to occur inside them. They can optionally be provided with Forge Energy (FE), which they will drain at 10FE/t. If FE is provided, they will act as a <thing>charged environment/$ for <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reactions/$. They are mainly used for performing <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/alchemy)reactions/$ automatically.$(br2)
